body:
This was an error when I had `-pedantic` on. Apparently default args for lambdas were only ratified in c++14. 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6281472/why-does-a-default-argument-for-a-lambda-argument-trigger-a-pedantic-gcc-warni

I gave up pedantic when I figured setuptools doesn't allow me to make pybind11 into a system header (-isystem), because it would have to appear before the cpp file and extra_compile_args puts them after
body_html:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6281472/why-does-a-default-argument-for-a-lambda-argument-trigger-a-pedantic-gcc-warni

I gave up pedantic when I figured setuptools doesn't allow me to make pybind11 into a system header (-isystem), because it would have to appear before the cpp file and extra_compile_args puts them after
body_text:
This was an error when I had -pedantic on. Apparently default args for lambdas were only ratified in c++14.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6281472/why-does-a-default-argument-for-a-lambda-argument-trigger-a-pedantic-gcc-warni
I gave up pedantic when I figured setuptools doesn't allow me to make pybind11 into a system header (-isystem), because it would have to appear before the cpp file and extra_compile_args puts them after
